Reviews.Title: “Location is good”
Reviews.Author: ErinLeary
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Courtyard properties. These places do a good job at providing decent places to stay with minimal amenities. This one also offers a great location for San Francisco touring. Located at the West end of the Fisherman's Wharf area, it is close to a lot of great sites and sights. It is a part of Anchorage Square, a mostly empty shopping area that I hope is just under renovation. We had a room with a "courtyard" view, and it looked down the interior of Anchorage Square that was being fixed up and had people milling about. The noise level was OK - tended to quiet down by about 11 p.m. I asked for a room that was above the street, and was on the 3rd floor - out of 4 - so it was OK. Parking was an extravagant $41 a night with tax. I did use it since having the valet get it was helpful. Lots of places to walk to and great places to eat very near by. One in particular was the Beach Street Grill. We ate there for breakfast a couple of times and it was very good. Overall, it was a fine stay - nothing too special, but the location more than makes up for the fact that it's fairly basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great family spot- close to pier”
Reviews.Author: Uphill_from_Denver
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, real queen sized beds. Stylish lobby. My family and I stayed here for 5 nights over spring break. We had a great time. Our room was quiet, and had a nice balcony but NO view whats so ever of anything. The hotel was very up front about this both over the phone and during checking. Perhaps higher rooms might get a bit of a city view? It was an eaasy walkt to the pier 39, fishermans wharf, and the trolley/street cars as well as the cable cars. Parking is a bit expensive, other than that no complaints

Reviews.Title: “good location!”
Reviews.Author: LYNNE M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Marriott fisherman’s wharf. The staff is friendly and the location is very convenient. We tried to have a late check out but we couldnt but that was understandable

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a little outside city noise, but otherwise just fine”
Reviews.Author: Karen R
Reviews.Content: I like most Marriott properties and this one was no different - clean, comfortable, and relatively quiet - some outside city noise could be heard but that must be expected in this wonderful central location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and conventient”
Reviews.Author: sarahbear760
Reviews.Content: Booked here because of the convenient location. This was our first big trip with our toddler. We wanted to stay somewhere with easy access to transportation, food and attractions. This was perfect. Plus, they offered a free mini-fridge in the room which made it easy to keep snacks for our son. To be honest, that was one of the deciding factors- free fridge, and free crib. The room was clean and of good size. Bed was comfortable. Staff was very helpful. F Street Cars just a short 2 blocks away. Bus #30 line was right behind hotel. Easy few blocks to Fisherman's Warf and Ghirardelli Square. I'd recommend to families because of the convenience inside and outside the hotel. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Spacious Rooms! Safe!”
Reviews.Author: jonjoncapy
Reviews.Content: My parents and i stayed at this hotel for about a week, and it was pretty mush what we expected from a Marriott hotel. The location was fantastic for it is close not only to Fisherman's Wharf, it was also close to a trolley station and cable car station where you have access to much of the city (check your map -- the trolley and the cable car takes you to two different parts of the city). There are also two car rental places pretty much on the premise (next door to the hotel). We rented at the Avis (the pother one is Hertz) and not only was the price reasonable ($34.00 a day), we were able to return it to the parking lot without any cost (parking can be up to $36.00 a day). There are also various tour companies nearby that can take you anywhere you want -- the concierge at the desk is helpful for these things, Although the hotel Bistro only serves breakfast (it's not bad, but it could be better),there are many places to eat within the hotel area. Breakfast was probably the best at the Denny's a block away located in the Holiday Inn. But as far as restaurants, there are plenty more nearby and it's also two blocks away from Ghirardelli where you can get chocolates and ice cream (as well as food).There are many shops nearby, including a Walgreens just a block away for basic needs (you can also buy souvineers there for a much cheaper price -- this advise was given by a front desk staff). The room was very clean and spacious, and very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again for a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ginnynj4133
Reviews.Content: A quick overnight at one of my favorite spots on the Wharf. Walkable distance to all good wharf eats, transportation and the general ambience of the Wharf, which is why I stay there when I can. Seagulls, fog horns and the bay all make this a favorite stop even for a day. Helpful staff at the Courtyard, comfortable slleping and great internet connections. Stay if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk Manager - Pathetic Service”
Reviews.Author: Neil K
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good, does NOT serve breakfast, NO ROOM SERVICE, no drinking water, absolutely pathetic staff, atrocious service. Stay here only for the location, NOTHING ELSE.. MARRIOTT does not deserve to be in such a good location. Make way for a better hotel. We checked in at 11 pm, tired and after a long drive from LA. The front desk manager refused to help us with water or even arrange for a bell boy for our luggage, he spoke rudely with a loud tone and was VERY ARROGANT. On our check-in he told us that our hotel stay payment was not made whereas we had made a prepaid reservation on Hotels.com.. While checking in and even after asking the manager did not tell us where we could find a trolley for moving our luggage. Wonder how Marriott can recruit such a person??!!??? Sack him now if u want more customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wenbrooks
Reviews.Content: I am princess & the pea, and the beds were awesome! The hotel was located one block from the Warf and within walking distance to so many attractions!! We even booked the hotel the following weekend when we returned. The staff was very nice and the rooms were clean! The parking was expensive at the hotel $36 so we parked in the garage next door for $25 which is still expensive but the $11 savings bought sourdough scones the next morning from Boudin's!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! everything you could expect from a Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Poohh66
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is perfectly located, within about a block of the happening Fisherman's Wharf. The staff is friendly, it is clean and it is up to par to a Marriott Courtyard. We would definitely come back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Friendly Right on the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: espressotritom
Reviews.Content: My wife accompanied me on a business trip so we were looking to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach. This Courtyard provided very good value. The room was surprisingly spacious, in excellent condition and very clean. The heating system was a bit too loud. Staff was always friendly and helpful. The Bistro serves Starbuck's coffee but no espresso drinks - a minor disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: vagabond2010
Reviews.Content: Access to this hotel is fairly easy. We parked our car in the self parking next to the hotel for 20 dollars for 24 hours with in and out privileges which is reasonable for San Francisco. Also parked one night on the street by hotel but be sure to read the signage. The hotel is very clean and quite typical for a Courtyard. The staff really tries to accommodate. We found them delightful. There is a tram stop by the hotel which takes you to the Embarcadero and beyond. Go to the Ferry building where you can walk around and also get a culinary sampling of San Francisco. If you happen to be there on a Tuesday eat at Wise Sons deli outside the entrance as part of the Tuesday Farmer's market...amazing made from scratch sandwiches etc. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for a courtyard”
Reviews.Author: jlk703
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Courtyard for two nights last month. Very clean, nice people. Our room looked out over Anchorage Square. A subway and some tables in this "square" -- It was not the quietest location. Loud carts going across rough pavement after 11pm and before 6am. The ceilings were also thin or else we had an elephant in the room above us. No complimentary breakfast at this location which would have made the price a little more palatable. Location was fantastic though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... Pleasant, well maintained rooms”
Reviews.Author: ggcaiazzo
Reviews.Content: Marriott is consistent in it's quality and this Hotel lives up to it's name. Great staff and reasonable rooms in the heart of San Francisco, convenient to the Warf, Little Italy and Chinatown. The only drawback is that parking was $48 a night... outrageous...

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mekki_E
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. First off the rooms are large, clean, bathrooms are nice sized and up to date. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very centrally located down on the wharf. It's located right next to the canary, a few blocks from Fisherman"s Wharf and just several blocks from pier 39. I have to say that we stayed during the off season so I can only imagine how crowded this place could get during in season. I recommend that when parking you use the Hotel parking. It is more expensive a night than the parking lot just next door; however you get in and outs which the public parking doesn't allow. The fitness room had very modern equipment that worked and was clean. There are several places to eat all near by and they have a restaurant in the hotel that is good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Vidal Family”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place. We loved everything, especially breakfast. Personnel were also very kind. Valet parking was very convenient. Location could not be better, near the touristic neighborhood of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For An Unremarkable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNjMoma2
Reviews.Content: Considering the location of this hotel and what you're paying for it, this Marriott is completely unremarkable. Sure it's clean and as I said, the location which is block or two away from the fun that is Fisherman's Wharf, is great, but the place itself if just average. It has only four floors so if you want to see the Bay, book the third or fourth floors (there was a waiting list for those when we booked) otherwise you'll have a view of an unremarkable courtyard. The room had a mini-fridge which was nice for storing breakfast and the staff is merely competent. When the door to our patio broke, it took a good 2 days for them to fix it despite the fact that it was a security risk. The Exercise Room, was small and stuffy with one of the two treadmills not working and no one eager to repair it. Again, considering how pleased my family usually is with Marriotts, this is a substandard one. Here's a tip: if you want to buy breakfast ,snacks, souvenirs, and postcards, go to the Walgreens around the corner from the hotel. Everything was much cheaper there.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Ismamart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in San Francisco. You can reach pier 39 within 10 minute walk. Plenty of shops and restaurants around the area. Good Public transport near by that will take you to main San Francisco attraction. The rooms are good size and clean. Staff was helpful. If you take your car be ready to spend big bucks in parking, but that's just San Francisco. An average of $40 per car for valet parking. There is public parking garage almost next to the hotel that is slightly cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Grat location and staff”
Reviews.Author: RobAngMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for both work and pleasure. Staff very helpful and friendly, especially the valet team. Very clean modern hotel in a great location a block from Fisherman's Wharf. Everything within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Work hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMTSkip911
Reviews.Content: For the price in San Fran this hotel was in a great location. Right by the Wharf by everything in walking distance. the hotel just finished a major remodel about a year ago. The rooms where nice. The only downside no food or bar on site. Being so close to everything it was never a far walk to find anything and everything you need. I would stay at this hotel if I returned to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location, and service at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: JohnnieFrank
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and comfortable, and service was courteous and not a bit stuffy or snooty. The location is great - a very short walk to the Pier 39. We even walked to the Alcatraz boarding area at Pier 33, to North Beach, Chinatown, the Financial District, and Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Cook57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Arrived on a Saturday and stayed until Thursday. Close by to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Easy to hop on the Trolley or Cable Car. Staff at hotel was wonderful, room was great. Unlike a previous review we found the hotel to be very quiet. Our room was right across from the elevator which concerned me at first but there was not noise. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CbinBigD
Reviews.Content: Great location, standard Courtyard room, very clean. Front desk, bistro and valet parking all friendly and very good service. Recommended, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulsReview
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights; itâ€™s within easy walking distance of fishermanâ€™s warf and still quiet enough at night to get good nights sleep. The room that we were in was not very large but it was well appointed. We had breakfast every morning in the hotel and it was great every morning. The hotel staff are very welcoming and especially so towards our children. If you would like to visit the centre of San Francisco itâ€™s easy to get a taxi from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business stay and meeting”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia8002
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights as part of a workshop that I organized. The location was great, not really downtown but within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and some other great spots by the water. When the weather is clear, sunsets along the docks are wonderful. My room was quiet, clean and fairly spacious for being in San Francisco. I didn't use housekeeping as I was running in and out of my room for the two days, but room service was prompt and courteous. The elevators are a little slow but even though the hotel was sold out, I never waited very long for one to arrive. With respect to the meeting I organized, the hotel staff was amazing. They responded very quickly to an on-the-spot request for a vegetarian meal and were very non-intrusive when changing out the coffee/sodas/snacks in the meeting space. The only area that could use some improvement is the restaurant/bar. I used it for dinner and drinks, and they seemed a little short-staffed. The bartender took our order most of the time, and he was dealing with a bunch of tables, plus the people at the bar, so the service was definitely slow. All-in-all, it was a good hotel for a business trip. If I was coming for a personal visit, I'd probably opt to stay closer to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: m_tav
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay. The rooms were tastefully appointed, well-maintained and very clean. The front reception staff, David and Ric, were accommodating, responsive and informative. Our room, which faced the courtyard, was quiet. The only downside would be the cost of the room, which seemed pricey considering the only thing included was free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip marred by "Crippled" Internet!”
Reviews.Author: 60-degreese-North
Reviews.Content: High hopes of this hotel before arrival (as reflected in the cost...) and what do we get? Another bland Marriott brand, but this time marred by the worst business internet facilities I have ever come across. Two weeks previously I experienced the best of internet connections - in India! The USA is (on the whole) in comparison, a "third world" internet dessert where US hotels are concerned - and this is definitely the worst. 1. No internet facilities in the business meeting rooms (not all of us want to work in he lobby!), 2. Flakey and half-crippled intenet in the rooms at $12.95 a day (plus taxes) for something that cuts out every 3-5 minutes and won;t connect to a vpn. Skype calls necessitated re-dialling at least twice every 10 minutes. Marriott are paying AT&T (all tack and absolute trash?) for something that is worthy of the 1980s - and here we are up the road from Silicon valley! As ever the Aircon in the hotel necessitated wearing more clothes indoor than outside and the usual effects on the sinuses. The food was also average. Best part of the stay were Lily, Alex, Rico and Mike in the conference service - who did their best but are not the management. Mr Marriott! - put your hotel and internet FACILITIES in order - but leave the staff alone - they are really great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Comfort and Location.”
Reviews.Author: beantownmba
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. This four-story Courtyard is located near Fisherman's Wharf, in the heart of the tourist region and at the last stop of the F line Bus/Street Car line, or a short walk from the Powell cable car. The staff are welcoming and accomodating. The hotel includes a small (15x20ish?) gym (cardio equipment and some dumbbells and a cafe. Free coffee is available in the lobby/lounge in the mornings. The rooms are comfortable, providing a flat-screen hd tv, mini-fridge, desk, and sitting area with couch/seat/table. Being a tourist area, the location is surrounded with shopping, restaurants and food. However, even in tourist season, I found the hotel to be surprisingly quiet at night (I did have a room on the back side of the hotel, which the front desk staff informed me is quieter - might be worth a request!). A word of caution - as with all hotels in San Francisco, parking here is outrageous. Stick to public transportation and/or walking, if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel H
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky when it comes to hotels- being that it was the first time we would be visiting San Francisco I wanted a place that was mainly clean and close to the attractions. I was very pleased. We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking the courtyard- although it wasn't the best view it was quiet at night, clean, and the bed was comfortable. Plus, i think the way the hotel is positioned there really isnt a "good" view from the hotel- you can not see the Golden Gate bridge from here. We didn't try the cafe, mainly because there were so many great restaurants nearby for breakfast. There are also many lunch and dinner spots that were good, although pricey. It's about 3 or 4 miles from the bridge. Also, if you love to run its the perfect place to stay since its just a block or two from a running path that goes along the bay all the way to the bridge. There are many runners in this area so you won't feel alone either if you want to go early in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, especially if you want to experience all of the touristy stuff SF has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: maestrette
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights here, but would not stay here again. It is in the middle of the touristy area if you enjoy that. However, several things marred our stay. The hotel has air conditioning units mounted below the windows that are very loud if they are turned on. The humidity level in the hotel is very high, so you have to run the a/c to be able to tolerate it. The toilets are the type that you would find in a public restroom, not in your home. They flushed very loudly, and we heard every toilet flush in the rooms surrounding us. We had an interior room, and there was construction going on outside our window. The jackhammers started at 8:00 am on three of the mornings we were there. The valet refused to call a taxi for us, so we were left to stand on the street with all of our luggage and wave down one ourselves. Definitely not what you expect in a hotel that you are paying $300 a night for!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: allisonpr
Reviews.Content: Went to San Fransicso for a friends wedding and I must say this hotel has one of the BEST locations if you like walking along the wharf. All of the staff were very friendly and assisted with all of our questions and answered them professionally and gave great directions to everywhere we wanted to go. Their were only two bad things about this hotel. the first was the screamming kids in the room next door. We had a connecting door to that room, so maybe that's why their screams seemed so loud. But i definitely could have done without hearing the screaming kids. The other bad part of this hotel was the shower. The water temperature was no where close to stable. You could not keep the water comfortable. Its like when someone in another room flushed a tolilet or turned on a faucet your temp either went to scalding or freezing cold. Was probably one of the WORST showers I have ever had to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Location- Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ginaggg
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in this hotel on Sept 8 2011. It is in perfect location 5 min walk to Pier 39, Garidelli Square and hundreds of restaurants are near by as well as many ferries, and water attractions ( Bay cruises, catamaran cruises, trip to Alcatraz ect. It is around 3-3.5 miles along water stroll to Golden Gate Bridge. Beginning stations of a cable car ( Tylor St and Hyde St ) are few min away as well. Hotel is very nicel. Clean, quiet, with nice decor and computers for guests in the lobby ( perfect for printing boarding passes and checking emails. Wi Fi was free as well

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: nohea72
Reviews.Content: I was in SF for business and this hotel worked out very well since it was close to the stores I had to visit. I never had a car and walked or took cabs to get around. I had no problem walking around early or late in the evening, felt safe. I did get upgraded to a larger room since I am a returning visitor which was great. The room was quite large with a couch and desk area. The only drawback was no view, I was looking out to the Anchorage Shopping Center and my room was right above Hooters. It really was only loud one night our of the week I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to the Wharf.”
Reviews.Author: romazicon
Reviews.Content: The main attraction of this hotel for us is it's convenient location to the Wharf. It was a 15 minute walk to Pier 39 and a 10 minute walk to Ghiradelli Square. It's also within 5 minutes of a trolley stop as well as numerous cab stations. There are several bicycle rentals nearby which made it convenient to sightsee by foot and by bicycle. This was such a plus since driving in this city and finding/having to pay for parking can be such an inconvenience. The hotel itself was also very nice and typical of most Marriott Courtyards we've stayed at. Our room had tasteful modern decor (apparently renovated within the last couple of years) and was adequately appointed for our family of five (2 queens and a rollaway bed). Continental breakfast was adequate. Outside of that, we didn't use the hotel much since we were out and about each day we were there. Service was excellent, especially from the front reception staff and parking valet. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: SLearn
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, but it's noisy and the room was smaller than advertised. The concierge recommended awful places to eat and we got charged for newspapers we never received or asked for. The coffee in the lobby was always empty in the morning when I arrived. There are nicer places for the same or less money if you look around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvRboys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the rooms are a good size (especially for the bay area). I can't say enough about the staff, everyone was so pleasant and helpful. The location is ideal. We parked our car and walked everywhere or took the trolley. We'd definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff -- wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreaminoftravelin17
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Marriott Courtyard Fisherman's Wharf. The staff went out of their way to assist in any way we needed. They were always so friendly whenever we went in and out of the hotel. The location was perfect! The 'guys' in our party could walk to the boat for their Fishing Trip in the bay. The 'gals' got picked up for their WIne Trip to Sonoma a couple of blocks away. Pier 39 and Pier 33 (Alcatraz) were very doable walks. We even walked back ( a long walk) from the Ferry Building (Pier 1), but could easily catch the streetcar there also. The cable car turnaround is also within a couple of blocks. There is a liquor store and Walgreens in the same block. Our queen double (one of the few hotels in SF with queens) was very nice sized with a small sitting area and a mini-fridge. The only thing that could be improved was the mini-fridge door was not useful as we assumed there was a bar that used to be there to hold stuff in that was missing. Other than that, everything was perfect! I would definitely stay there again! Be sure to ask them to arrange for your transportation back to the airport from the hotel. We had a harrowing experience in a taxi when we arrived and an excellent towncar when we left (that they arranged) and the price was the same!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Moab3
Reviews.Content: We liked the location of this hotel as it was set one street back from the 'glitz' of the main street on Fisherman's Wharf, yet it was very easy to get to places. The hotel was very clean and our room with two queen beds was very comfortable and well furnished. The bathroom was also good. The staff were without exception friendly and very helpful. We were however a little disappointed that our room only had a view of the multistorey car park next door, but at least it was quiet at night. Parking was also expensive ($36 plus tax per night) though this seemed to be the going rate for hotels in this area. It was however very easy to get around by public transport as the old fashioned restored trams brought from all over the world on the F Route stopped literally just at the end of the block (2 minute walk) and for a $2 ticket took us all along the waterside, including close to the Alcatraz Tours Pier and then right into the commercial centre of SF and beyond. (Worth a trip) It was also easy to walk west to get to the Marina District (more picturesque and less commercial than Fisherman's Wharf) and the start of the Cable Car line (a very exciting ride into central SF going up and down the hills!) There are also a number of bicycle hire outlets close by, we hired bikes and cycled the Golden Gate Bridge. We did not eat in the hotel brassery as we preferred to go to one of the highly rated Cafes nearby .There were also one or two really nice restaurants within easy reach for evening meals. (see restaurant section) Overall good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: zathras777
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good rate available for our 2 night stay and the location was prefect. Room was clean, staff friendly and knowledgeable. I forgot to book Alcatraz tickets and after phoning and talking with the concierge he arranged a tour that included Alcatraz for our stay. They had a discounted rate for parking in the next door car park of just $25/night with full in/out privileges which was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: ds444
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed here during our trip to San Francisco. Our room was big enough to accomodate two adults and two teenage boys. We did use a roll away bed so our sons wouldn't have to share a bed and we still didn't feel cramped. The bathroom was large and everything was really clean. A big plus because nobody likes a filthy room. We stayed in room 231 and we didn't have a view of anything but the parking garage, but that wasn't a big deal to us. The only negative I would say is that there was an alley between the garage and the hotel. At night and also very early morning- 4 am to be exact you would hear random fights or yelling from homeless people who are all over the place, down at the wharf. It's not the hotels fault, but it was annoying. The hotel is very convenient to everything. We walked to Chinatown and it took about 15-20 mins, but you can take public transportation to get anywhere you need to go fast. The wharf was fun for a day, but I think if we went again we would stay in Union Square. The touristy feel just got old fast. All in all the hotel is a nice place to stay if you decide to stay at fisherman's wharf. It's convenient to restaurants (Hooter's and In and Out burger are right next door) as well as Boudin Bakery(clam chowder in bread bowl a must). There's a walgreens around the corner if you need. The concierge at the hotel was great and I loved that he recommended and arranged we take a limo for a few bucks more to the airport for a 4 am departure. It was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good or Excellent...can't decide”
Reviews.Author: jeff-from-hamilton
Reviews.Content: This was definitely an above average hotel, and the price (for San Fran) other than the parking rate was excellent. The best part was the location - just steps from Fisherman's Wharf and right in the heart of all the "touristy" things. It had everything we expected - clean, safe, friendly staff etc. I only hesitate to give it an excellent rating as it didn't exceed my expectations or have that "wow" factor, so I guess a very good will do.....

Reviews.Title: “good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Blerke
Reviews.Content: this is a good basic hotel well located for tourists wanting to visit golden gate bridge. The room and bathroom were well equipped and clean. There are plenty of cycle hire shops quite close but get there before 11 am in high season or they may run out of bicycles! Dont cycle the bridge on a sunday...everyone does! From the outside you could miss that this was a hotel but it suited our requirements of a double/double room. Ask for the highest floor you can as in any city it can be noisy, as far as Im aware there are no "views" from the rooms. TV channels and free internet access which we've come to expect.were good There was a laundry room which was useful and free tea and coffee in the lobby. The staff were friendly and helpful. valet parking is $36 per night

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CarolnIan
Reviews.Content: Very clean and staff friendly and efficient. Pictures on website led us to expect more. In reality looked quite a dull exterior, though interior modern and clean/tidy. Not particularly impressed with Fisherman's wharf, a lot more commercially 'cheap' than we expected, though there were a couple of very nice restaurants nearby. Beware, there were a couple of not so nice ones too. Preferred the area away from the centre of the wharf - i.e. Pier 39, further round the embarcadero etc. Only other thing was the noise that could be heard through the windows of our room. We were at the back of the hotel (I think) with no views to speak of, (other walls etc.) and we could hear everything, just as though the windows were open (which they weren't). Not a terrible place by any standards, but very, very pricey for what we got. In hindsight, would have stayed on Nobb Hill for the same money, and used the cable cars/trams more to access the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the heart of the wharf”
Reviews.Author: vacyclist27
Reviews.Content: It's the standard Courtyard property in the heart of the wharf. There is nothing special about the price or about the hotel. The parking is pricey. The breakfast is overpriced, so save your money and have breakfast at one of the many better places within walking distance. The main advantage is the In-n-Out Burger around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: jimbahr08
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, seems like it was renovated recently. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was near many restaurants and shops but it wasnt noisy at all. Rooms were very nicely appointed with comfortable beds. Parking was on the high side but after looking around was cheaper than some other locations in the city (San Fran parking is limited in many areas hence the hight cost). Hotel provides several PC's in the lobby for customer use, along with printers. This made it very easy to book tours and print out the confirmations. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would stay again next time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ColoTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location in the Fishermans Wharf area. On the same block as the F-line trolley end of the line, a block off the waterfront and about a block from the cable car. Rooms are large, and the double queens even have a sleepr sofa. For thoserenting a car, both Avis and Hertz have rental counters immediately next door tot he hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: ltunick
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco over the July 4th weekend. This Marriott location was perfect. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. The room was spacious and I particularly liked having 2 queen beds to accommodate a family of 4. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ILTravelLover77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, had a great time! The front desk staff had a tendency to be less than friendly, but it was clean. The location was good, and we were able to enjoy ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: iver0185
Reviews.Content: GREAT location - right near Fisherman's Wharf. Friendly staff. Rooms weren't special. Smelled a bit. Could have used a pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would go back and stay again”
Reviews.Author: LoveMeSomeOysters
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time (2 adults, 3 kids (16-14-10). We drove in from L.A. and used the valet which was a bit pricey (about $41/night by the time they added on the various taxes, etc.), but no other options. Public parking garage next door had several break-ins and Mariott told us that they were not responsible if we had parked our car in the public parking garage which was $32/night. The entire hotel staff was incredible.....exceptionally helpful and friendly. Rooms were large and clean. Beds very comfortable with at least 6 pillows on each bed. The location is fantastic...... literally food options the second you step out of the front door.... from real dining, to casual to fast food. Walgreen's on the corner provided drinks for the mini fridge in the room. Starbuck's brewed and complimentary every morning in the lobby. They suggested several great breakfast options within less than a block walking distance (Joanie's Happy Days and Beach Grill)----both excellent. Also about a block away is the cable car and roughly 8 blocks is Pier 39 & 33 (Alcatraz) which we walked to both as the weather was pleasant. Ghiradelli Square a very short walk as well. Really it made no difference which way you walked as there was shopping and food at every angle. Bring your wallet as NOTHING is cheap. Breakfast for 5 was easily $80 (pancakes, eggs, waffles, etc). Another tip...... bring a jacket...it was windy and the average temp in mid-June was 65; it was chilly in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodel - Marriott quality and fair price”
Reviews.Author: RogerRLMLAB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Sharkfest 2011 Alcatraz Island open water swim and was very impressed with the recent remodel and fair price for an excellent location. Rooms and service were excellent and valet service was very accommodating. There may be some cheaper hotels in this area, and there are certainly more expensive ones, but the remodeled Marriott Courtyard at Fisherman's Wharf would seem to be the best deal, at least for now. We will stay here again next year for the 20th annual Alcatraz Island swim!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 3 stars indeed”
Reviews.Author: Marina.Diana
Reviews.Content: I spent there six nights in December. This hotel has a fantastic location , just a short distance from a seaside with a magnificent view over San Franciso Brigde and Alcatraz, 8 mins walk to the famous Pier 39 or 3 mins walk to THAT tram first stop. And its situated in the picturesue Fishermans' Wharf with a lot of fantastic seafood shops and restaurants. Try to find some time and go for "the best hot chocolate with the best view in the world" - Ghirardelli! My sons loved these chocolates as souvenir gifts when I brought them some home. Hotel is very average, elderly, used and with the slow staff. I was supposed to stay in another Marriott just a few blocks further and it is much better - some members of our group stayed there, so I have comparison. One final note about San Francisco. There is no shops with toys which is a real nighthmare discovery for "mum-in-business-trip-intstead -being -present-in-nativity-school -show"! It took me a day to find it out! So better buy straight these delicious chocolates there instead of toys. Itself SanFran is spectacular BUT everybody knows it. Next time I have to stayhowever in another hotel definietely!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lpaoli23
Reviews.Content: Pros Location Location Location Great little restuarant with delicious breakfast options to purchase Computers and News on TouchScreen TV in lobby Rooms Large Cons Very weird layout to the hotel- connected to other buildings, walkways etc. Staff was so-so Noisy Not good for long stays because of the scaled back amenities but that is why its a courtyard and not a reg marriott

Reviews.Title: “Loud hotel with few amenities”
Reviews.Author: Barbsrubyslippers
Reviews.Content: Property is situated next to Hooter's and In and Out Burger. On our first night, (a Sat.) there were guys walking through the courtyard, yelling playing catch football. This was around 1:30 am. Then at 5:30 am the owner of the bicycle rental store, inside the courtyard began hammering. This lasted for about 30 minutes, and I finally called the front desk to request another room. The person working acted surprised that we found the hotel to be loud, saying that no one else had complained, and that the courtyard facing rooms were the more quiet rooms. After reading other reviews we decided to stay put since other rooms were just as exposed to the parking garage and garbage truck noise. One trick is to keep the ac unit running to block out courtyard people's conversation. Towels were flimsy and shampoo scarce. I agree with another reviewer that the hallways smell. However, the 2 queen beds and plenty of pillows, were very comfortable. Also, the 2nd floor bistro is very clean with nice breakfast options, but for the price, better to walk to the actual Starbucks at the back of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a city base”
Reviews.Author: local_yokal69
Reviews.Content: Drove up from the sierras and stayed here 4 nights.Rained a lot but still had a great time. Wife daughter (6) and myself. The car rental was 20 steps away so very easy to drop car off. Would not keep a car here. Bought the city pass which got us to Alcatraz (have to buy it at the Alcatraz site to get this) and the museum (great) and a couple other sites. Was a savings and since we had rain so much inside was a nice place to be. Ate at the Italian seafood place across the street ( What was that name!!!) and was really good. IOther then that my brother had us to the local places Hotel clean, quiet, and very close to the cable car/muni system (also part of city pass) Would stay here again no complaints. nice little business area in the lobby. never got up early enough for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: vertebreaker
Reviews.Content: We were stuck without a reservation because of mess up with another hotel chain. Rex at front desk made sure we were accomodated and even got us a complimentary rollaway for kids. Amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: csns08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this location for one night. We arrived after check in time, the room was ready, front desk was very helpful, and asked why were here? We let them know we would be going to the giants game that night and instantly he gave us a map and what transportion we could use and the times and fares , it was so nice to not have to figure that out! The room was very clean - shower super clean, which is a big ? For most hotels, overall we would definitley stay here next time we come to sf!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: centxwx
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant four-night stay at this hotel May 3-7. The staff was outstanding, as everyone seemed intent on making us feel welcome and went out of their way to greet us as we departed or returned each and every time. The concierge (I believe his name was Edward) was very helpful, as were the valet parking guys. About the only negative I can think of was that our room fronted on Beach Street, as was noisy at times. All in all, this was a very pleasant place and we'll likely return the next time we head for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean and well maintained. Perfectly located to fisherman's warf.”
Reviews.Author: mvitenas
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in the heart of fisherman's warf. The hotel appears new and is well maintained and clean. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Hertz and Avis are right next door. Paid $179.00 a night

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Zman73
Reviews.Content: I always tend to stay at Marriotts when I travel. This hotel lived up to the Marriott expectations. The room was very clean, the neighborhood was amazing and the staff was willing to please. Within one block there is the Hollywood Cafe, which served up a great breakfast. The Buena Vista for Irish coffees, cable cars and of course the famed Fishermans wharf. I would definately stay here again,.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelers090
Reviews.Content: We will stay here the next time we are in San Francisco. The rooms were clean and quite large. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us tips on good eating establishments and good directions in finding them. We had a small problem with the television and it was fixed within 15 minutes of our call to the main desk. The only flaw was that the service in the Bistro Cafe was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay, nice location”
Reviews.Author: JoeIIe
Reviews.Content: Comfy, spacious room (there were 3 of us, so we took a room with 2 Queen beds). Clean toilet. Free in-room wi-fi! Has a cafe that sells breakfast and Starbucks coffee in the morning. If you don't want to splurge on that, hotel offers free coffee/tea till 10am every morning. Hotel has a corner selling juices, chocolates, chilled sandwiches and cup noodles (though they do not display prices). Walgreens just round the corner. (Don't buy from the overpriced wine shop beside the hotel - its mineral water is 3x the price of Walgreens'). However upon check-in, we were given a trolley to push our luggage to the room ourselves (and return the trolley after that). Strange but maybe that's the practice there... Nevertheless, staff super helpful when we needed to book a cab to the airport. They suggested a more comfy town car as it's about the same price. Very near Ghirardelli Square, walking distance to Pier 39 (love this place. carnival feel, lots of shops to browse around) and the Aquarium. Bicycle rental right downstairs. Rent a bicycle to bike to the Golden Gate Bridge. Great stay, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Just Coffee”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Had some Marriott points to burn so flew up to San Francisco for a long weekend. Hotel was in a great location easy walk to everything. Rooms were typical seemed recently upgraded. Hotel is in a older complex that has retail on the ground floor, under the rooms. Our room was on the 4th floor but the 1st floor was a Hooters, convenient but the music could be heard until around midnight. Didn't keep me awake but I am a heavy sleeper, my wife heard all of it. The other thing I thought was strange is they had free coffee in the morning but that was it, if you wanted anything else you had to go to their store or to the bistro on the 2nd floor. Overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chrysanthemum29
Reviews.Content: The room is big, clean, and modern. The windows open 6-7 inches which is nice if you like to get fresh air in the room. The quality of the mattress was not that great. Our room had a couch that is expendable. This hotel is right in the middle of it all: short walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square, 15 minute drive to downtown and the Exploratorium. The hotel has a Bistro that is only breakfast and a meal is about $10. The food is good and the service is excellent. Review written by Helen, age 11

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mingxue
Reviews.Content: I would recommend staying at this hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. Most staff were friendly and helpful. There was no pool which would have been nice for the children. There is a small fridge in the room. Overall though pretty basic but clean and good for our needs. Close to Fisherman's Wharf. Internet was free but quite slow. Our room overlooked a court area and there tended to be noise filtering up to the room but still....not a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 6tareg
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is definitely cityfied: sparse, modern decor and sleek furnishings and fixtures. The lobby felt like it belonged more in an apartment building than a hotel, but everything was spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and spacious - the bed linens crisp, bright white and comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and had very modern granite and silver finishes. The hotel is low rise, has a small cafe, and is steps from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. If you are a light breakfast eater, you may want to pick up some yogurt at the local Walgreens a block away and store it in your mini fridge in your room. There is a small bakery around the corner as well that opens at 8:00 a.m. The hotel's cafe charged $2.25 for a tiny cup of yogurt. Understandable. Only drawback to the location of the Courtyard, was the selection of restaurants that were close by. Most fell into the tourist trap category and did not get favorable reviews on the various foodie sites. Thus prices are high and food quality just so so. There is the famous In and Out Burger franchise right next door. I don't know what all the fuss is about, as the burger was just ok. Nevertheless, it's a cheaper food alternative for the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent lighting and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: travelingengr
Reviews.Content: I like to work in the hotel room when I travel for business, and most hotels don't have sufficient lighting. This one was an exception. It has excellent lighting. They have 5 guest computers in the lobby, 3 on a desk with a chair and two on a counter which you have to use standing up. The ones on the counter are for printing boarding passes only. My bed was very comfortable and there was plenty of drawer space. The room has a high-def TV with free HBO and HDNet Movies. The bathroom was clean, nothing exceptional, but nice. The only down side I can think is that my room was facing a parking structure, so my only view was cars in the structure. The hotel is in a great located in Fisherman's Wharf, with plenty of restaurants to choose from. The hotel staff was very friendly. My room was very quiet. The hotel is few blocks from bus lines and cable car, so it is very convenient to travel around San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Central location”
Reviews.Author: ruckbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a wedding on Marriott Rewards Points. The staff was excellent for providing transportation, rest recomdations & reservations! The room was great and within walking distance to everththing! The breakfast room & staff were exceptional and the food was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great area for Wharf but more expensive then staying in fancy nob hill”
Reviews.Author: mrcanfield3
Reviews.Content: We planned a week in San Fran and Napa by doing 3 days in San Fran, stayed at the courtyard by the wharf to start the trip for 3 nights, at a wonderful B&B in Napa called the Old World Inn for 3 nights, and the Stanford Court Renaissance in Nob Hill for 2 nights. This was the most expensive place we stayed per night and the worst of the 3 we stayed at. It is a great location for the wharf and little italy, but for the most part you are paying to stay at the wharf which after 3 days gets on your nerves.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish All Hotels Could Be As Comfortable, Clean & Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: Newhiker1
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Courtyard, Fisherman's Wharf. For the past two months, I've stayed in several hotels thru-out the Bay Area and Central Coast for my business travels. This was by far my best experience, overall, for the hotel value, cleanliness, comfort, safety, convenience of location, and the local amenities available nearby. I slept sooo comfortably I hated to leave! I normally toss and turn in hotel beds. But the hotel was very quiet, the room was quite spacious and clean with wifi and plenty of work space. It was an easy walk to the Fisherman's Wharf attractions, including Pier 39. Oh, and the staff were especially pleasant, helpful with tips, and very customer service-oriented. I didn't get to experience the onsite restaurant or exercise room, but I'm glad they were available. The only issue would be with the hotel parking -- about $38 a day :(. Even so, street parking is near impossible in this area and ALL parking lots are expensive. So, on a good note, the hotel parking garage was right next door, so I didn't have to walk far or worry about my car. With that, kudos to Marriott! I'd definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellet stay at the wharf”
Reviews.Author: Patpetruca
Reviews.Content: Third time visiting San Francisco, wanted to stay in the wharf with my friends. Read the reviews before choosing the hotel. I just can say that everything I read was absolutely true. The rooms were spacious, clean and neat. Staff was incredibly helpful. Asked for an adjoining room, evereything was set when I arrived. Complained about the plumbing in my sink, as they couldn't fix immediately, offered me another room at no cost. Next day, as I chose to stay in the same room, the sink problem was sorted out. Location is superb, restaurants, tourists shops, walgreens and street car stop just around the corner. Pier 39 is three minutes away. Hope you get a best price for the stay, as I booked just one week in advance, I got 165,00 per day, which I think was worth it, but I know you can get the same hotel category in the same location for a little less. Definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in SF”
Reviews.Author: glasgowcelticgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed Veterns day weekend at Courtyard Fishermans Wharf. Was very pleased with room quality and size. Room looked brand new and was plenty big for a family of four. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We were on 3rd floor facing the Courtyard about a Hooters, so occasionly we did hear noise. They should really have double paned windows for this.They were also suggested a private car for return to airport which was only 3 more than taxi. Well worth the extra 3.00 for a lovely clean car with freindly driver. Hopefully we can return to this hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Arik_Gazit
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our staying!! There were 4 of us (including 2 teenagers). The room was very nice modern and renovate room. The location is great close to the Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car. The staff was very kind and helpful. our room was by an alley that was loud early in the morning so next time I will probably ask for anothe room location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean great location but a little loud”
Reviews.Author: ChipNewton
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and nice. the rooms were spacious and clean. The location was one of the best around if you wanted to visit Fisherman's Wharf. Everything looked new and I loved the available computors in the lobby for the guest to use, but our room was by an alley, a loud alley at about 6 in the morning. I would recommend it and I would stay again but maybe on another side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional concierge assistance”
Reviews.Author: bicycledoc
Reviews.Content: Last week spent 3 nights at this hotel (too short a time). It was great... the location was perfect, the weather exceptional, We rode bikes and walked everywhere. The "F" trolley was so easy to understand and ride on for those new to the city. We sought out the Concierge for assistance in purchasing tickets to local attractions. The walking tour of North Beach and Chinatown was a highlight of our trip. All staff members couldn't have been more helpful. We loved our room, very clean and loved the available computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot at the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Pete_Helen_Lucy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in mid September. The hotel is great. It has obviously been recently refurbished and the room we had was very nicely appointed. What particulary impressed me was the size of the room. Despite there being two double beds, there was still room for a couch and sitting area. Free coffee in the foyer each morning and evening was also a nice touch, as was the free high speed internet. The location is also fantastic, just one block away from the waterfront, fisherman's wharf and the cable cars. The only issue we had was with traffic noise in the early hours of the morning, particularly garbage trucks, but a pair of ear plugs (which I always travel with) sorted that out! One of the best tips we got from reading other reviews on Trip Advisor was that September can be very cold! - it was, but we came well prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CarlaBC97
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel! The rooms were comfortable, well designed and clean. The desk staff were friendly and pleasant. There was free computers to use (4) that were modern and quite fast internet speed. Free wi-fi in rooms too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NNJGAMER
Reviews.Content: I had never been to San Francisco before so I picked this hotel because it was near a few things that I wanted to do (Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz, & a cable car turntable). As it turned out it was perfect. You have to pay top dollar for parking but the garage is right next to the hotel so it works out great. The room was OK and the desk staff helpful. It is a busy area though so be prepared for there to be some noise outside until at lease 10 PM. After that it quited down and we had no issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: bandogal
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was clean quiet and comfortable. A perfect location for sightseeing and walking with out too many hills. Near lots of great restraunts. The hotel featured computers in the lobby and but too few seats to accomidate waiting quests. Decor was new and fresh and quest friendly. The concierge desk was often unmanned and 2 out of the 3 men at the desk helped with a very bored attitude. Unmarriott like attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while touring Fisherman's Wharf.....”
Reviews.Author: CKD63
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, large very nice rooms, clean, great staff. Walking distance to everything in fisherman's wharf. Parking was expensive (but a relative good value), and I had no problem finding a space. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a family with teens”
Reviews.Author: k4red
Reviews.Content: Our family (mom, dad, son 18, son 17) had a great visit at this Courtyard. The location is ideal: right on the wharf with Ghirardelli Square, Cable Cars, "F" line and tons of shopping within 2 blocks. I felt very safe in this neighborhood and didn't worry about walking around at night, or letting my boys have a little freedom looking at the shops. Plus, there is an "In and Out Burger" in the same complex which made for happy teenagers! There are really nice, free computers to use in the lobby so my boys could stay connected on Facebook easily. There is a cool "touchboard" , kind of like a huge ipad, in the lobby which was very fun to use. The staff was friendly and professional and the concierges very helpful and knowledgeable. The breakfast place provided good, healthy food for a reasonable price which helped us make the early morning tours. The rooms are generic Courtyard rooms but I felt they were a little bigger than most which we appreciated with 4 of us in the room. The rooms were clean and the amenities just what we needed. I could not have asked for anything more. The public transporatation system for SF is excellent: easy to use, clean, timely and safe. We bought the $20 3 day Muni pass which allows for unlimited use of the electric busses and cable cars. It worked out to be a great deal, not just for the $, but just knowing we could hop on a bus along the wharf to get back to our hotel easily. We took the Extranomical City Tour with Alcatraz and the Muir Woods/Sausalito Tour. Both were great and well worth our time. I liked Extranomical because they picked us up at our hotel right on time, we travelled in small but roomy vans with 10 people total and the tour guides were very responsive to any requests we had. Just a word of warning-if you travel in August and want to go to Alcatraz (and who doesn't?) get your tour tickets AT LEAST 10 days in advance. There are limited visitors allowed on the island and many people were very disappointed to see the tour sold out for 10 days solid. I liked both tours and thought they provided that "taste of" the city/Muir Woods/Sausalito that we were looking for. Both of my teenagers thought they were just the right length of time to hold their attention but not be boring. My husband and son took in a Giants game at AT&T park and thought it was wonderful. It's a bit of walk even using the "F" line but the weather was cool and the excitement was high so they didn't mind at all. Vacationing with teenagers can be tricky, but this trip to SF was just perfect. We were busy and enjoyed experiencing a city together. We stayed 3 1/2 days and felt that was just right. I would have enjoyed a little more shopping but with 3 men, it was probably better to leave than listen to them whine about going into yet another shop. :)

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: slowfatrunner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel July 23rd-28th, was in town to run the San Francisco half marathon. Walked out the frontdoor and everything was right there..restaurants, gift shops, musuems etc. Didn't even rent a car, could walk everywhere or take the extensive public transporation (bus, streetcar, subway, cable car). I was in a room with a king sized bed. There was a little sitting area with sleeper sofa and coffee table & was spacious enough. The room was on the 2nd floor facing Beach Street and I could hear loud drunk people walking by Fri & Sat night, but not that bad. Had breakfast at the Bistro 3 mornings. Went to Denny's 1st 2 mornings there and it cost close to $30 for just 2 people! So tried the Bistro last 3 mornings and it was a pleasant surprise and cheaper then Denny's. Didn't use the gym but checked it out since it was on my floor. This is by far one of the best hotel gyms I've ever seen. Has top notch treadmills, bikes, elipicals and free weights. Would recommend this hotel if you want to be in the center of Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “location in fisherman' s wharf”
Reviews.Author: carriglio
Reviews.Content: centrallylocated (only one block from ghirardelli square) ; reasonably priced compared with other hotels in SFO (200 US$ per night) Spacious rooms, good service. Fitness room available no swimming pool and spa

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the Wharf area with a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rrofsarasota
Reviews.Content: Even with the high parking rate, we found it to be a very good value for visiting the Wharf and San Francisco in general. The location would be hard to beat. The room was spacious and attractive. The wireless internet was reliable - and free. We only tried to have breakfast in the on-site Bistro once and found it to be disorganized and suffering from employee language barrier issues - but there are plenty of places to get good food and coffee within a short walk of the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Gators77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the piers. You can walk to the wharf, restaurants, shops, Lombard Street (famous for the crooked street), Alcatraz, trolley, Giradelli, and much more. The room was cozy, enough space for 2 people. Although the view was to the building next door, you could see Alcatraz from one of the windows. The hotel service was very nice; rooms, hallways and lobby were very clean. The only downside was the music and noise you could hear from outside, but once we turned on the t.v., you could hardly hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: moo_bear
Reviews.Content: This entire hotel has been beautifully and tastefully updated and our room provided a quiet, comfortable, modern oasis from the busy streets of Fisherman's Wharf outside. The bed and sofa bed (which our son slept on) were very comfortable and the room was spacious, as was the bathroom. While there is no swimming pool at the hotel and the restaurant has limited opening hours, there is no actual need for either. The location of the hotel is perfect, both for the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf and for quick eats - an In 'N' Out burger is on one corner and a Coldstone Creamery (delicious ice-cream) on the other corner of Anchorage Square. It is about a block to both the cable car turnaround and, in the other direction, the streetcar stop and you do not need a car (if you do have one, as we did, parking, although convenient, is expensive as is the norm in San Francisco). We would return to this hotel without hesitation and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ASK_TEXAS
Reviews.Content: Except for the higher cost for the parking, this hotel was just perfect. The lobby was impressive and the rooms were both uniquely decorated and pristine. Our balcony also had a nice view of the wharf area. The small workout room was adequate, with enough free weights to allow a decent workout routine while out of town. Personally, I wish more hotels would add more free weights and less of the "one size fits all" workout machines. As has been said in other reviews, the location is terrific. The entire wharf area is within an easy walking distance. Ghiardelli is only 3 blocks away. Public transportation, albeit confusing to the first timer, is available nearby. This hotel is obviously on the expensive side, especially with the $40/day parking. However, any really nice hotel in this location is going to cost you. With that being said, I feel like this hotel is a pretty good bargain for the location. If this hotel is within your budget, I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for family with teens!”
Reviews.Author: pburgess4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the center of everything we wanted to see/do. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. The cable cars and street cars had stops very close to hotel (1/2 block). Parking was expensive ($35/day), but we did need a car to go to Sausalito and Golden Gate Park, etc... We took the cable car into the downtown/Union Square/shopping area. My teenagers were able to ride on the outside of the cable car...They loved it! We walked through chinatown, nob hill, drove down Lombard Street. Great beach to visit...Crissy Field....Lots of windsurfers to watch. The hotel was nice, comfortable, sufficient room for 4, and clean. We asked for a roll away bed (the teens refuse to sleep together!) and the rollaway was just as comfortable as the bed (ranked by my teenage sons!). The staff was extremely helpful. They gave us a restaurant card and when we visited the restaurant (Joanie's), we handed them the card and they gave us a beautiful fruit plate for free. The staff always had maps available and would write on the maps how to quickly get to where we wanted to go. Exercise room was small, but had what I needed (decent treadmill). No pool, but we were so busy touring that we didn't have time for it anyway. No worries with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: hologramgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was positioned PERFECT it was perfectly placed in Fisher Wharf for us. We were 4 in a room and we were super comfortable. The beds are queen size and they felt Great!! The price was a bit high but then again you are staying in Fisherman Wharf and everything Fisherman Wharf is a bit overpriced. The hotel was super clean and overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: BrianLincolnshireUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights , hotel is in a good position between 2 cable car Termini, walking distance to Starbck,s and Safeways.Also on a bus route to Golden Gate Bridge and Park. Walking distance to Russian Hill Telegraph hill Coit Tower and North Beach (italian district). We liked Fisherman's Wharf even if the guide books do not and we like Marriott hotels the only downside was the restaurant only provided breakfast although room service was 24hour. Good value for San Francisco and for $11 3 days cable carsand buses to access other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: triptaker215
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with nice rooms. Not many amenities in the hotel, very basic. Definitely a good lcoation with easy access to the trolley cars and fisherman's wharf. They must have a side deal with the airport shuttle company they use. You can get a discount with the companyies listed in the travel book they have there but if you book it through Courtyard you don't get the discount, and you have to pay Courtyard "a deposit"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Walking distance to anywhere on the wharf...”
Reviews.Author: thri11a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. The staff was very helpful; they told us which bus to take to AT&T park (where it loaded/unloaded, etc...). The bus was only $2 per person round trip! The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable, the temperature could be as cold as you wanted it, and the wharf was a short walk away. Another bonus was the close proximity to a Walgreens. The only con we found was that the breakfast options in the hotel were very limited. We ended up walking across the street to a Denny's on the first day. Great hotel, decent price!

Reviews.Title: “Most Bang for Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: ohiocouple
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for the Memorial Weekend. Over the next 3 days this hotel won us over. I will say that when we pulled up our driver said "oh this used to the old Howard Johnson" which made feel like we had made a mistake. But after staying at the other Courtyard across town many times, I thought I'd give it a chance. Overall, the service was great and attentive, the lobby has free coffee in the morning, and we used the market a lot for healthy snacks and toiletries (which were all between $1-$3 - they didn't price up anything! Corona was only $3 too!). We were on the 3rd floor facing the parking garage. It was a bummer, but we're adults and knew we couldn't have everything we wanted in our price. I would ask for a room facing Beech street if possible for the additional windows (they protrude out). Location was amazing and was perfect for our needs. The Bistro on the second floor served really good food and was conveinant right before we left for SFO. I wish we would have known that there was a bike rental in the back courtyard of the hotel that connects it to In N Out. That would be have been so much easier than what we did. Also wish there was a pool. Gym was OK - newer with towels. Bathroom was normal and room was normal. After three days we really felt we got our money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: filmmaker55
Reviews.Content: We started our family vacation (of 8) in San Francisco and let me tell you, we couldn't have picked a better hotel to start our trip. The staff at the Courtyard Marriott are the friendliest around! Everytime you enter or exit the building, they greet you with a smile:) They are eager to help you any way they can. We pre-paid 3 rooms (2 rooms with 2 queens and 1 w/king) and received a reasonable rate in doing so. They were very accommodating and kept the rooms close together and even gave us connecting rooms for the queen rooms. Check-in was fast and we were in our rooms within minutes. The rooms were spacious and clean with nice amenities, including a fridge to hold a few cans of cold beer and bottles of water. The beds are very comfortable and they supplied plenty of pillows which is something my husband and I like because we are pillow hogs. The hotel is also very quiet and we did not hear any noise from outside or the hallways. The hotel is centrally located to the wharf and if you exit out the back, you'll be on the main street that takes you to the eateries and down to Pier 39. But you don't need to go far to find a quick bit to eat. In the courtyard you'll find Hooters and In and Out Burger. Across the street is pizza and in the side alley Subway. Just up the street is a Joanie's which is a great place for breakfast with killer pancakes! My husband's favorite, a beer store right beside the hotel so he never had to go far to restock:) A great spot to try for dinner is out the back doors and up the street to the left a couple blocks to Cioppino's which is an outstanding place to eat. (Check out my restaurant review on Cioppino's for more details). There is parking available for $34/day with in/out privileges which really isn't bad compared to other cities we've stayed in. The only downside, there are no safes in the rooms, which would be nice to hold your valuables when you leave the room. However, if you ask them at they desk, they will put them in a safe downstairs for you if you like. All in all, this a very clean, friendly, wonderful hotel that I would stay at again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Afcase
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel near Fishermans wharf. Very clean rooms. Great location for the wharf and for transportation to the rest of the city. Parking was $32/day but is in/out all day and the lot is just next door. Our first room 227 faced the parking deck was very noisy. Called the front desk and were offered a new room with upgraded windows. You could still hear some street noise but not much.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased !”
Reviews.Author: talkn2ya
Reviews.Content: We spent one night - and we were very pleased with our decision. We took the Bart from the airport - then the cable car - and ended up close to the hotel - so easy!! The staff is sooo nice and goes out of their way to help. The location is great - our room was very clean and we had plenty of room. The bathroom was a good size. The one thing that I liked was the flat screen tv that has a swivel - I have never had that yet - and it really helps when one wants to sleep and one doesn't. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barkwood66
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located to allow us to knock out all of the main San Francisco area sites in a few days. The staff was very attentive and responsive, the room was well maintained, and the lobby provided many conveniences (i.e. free coffee, free computer/internet usage, TV, etc.). The cable car line is just two blocks away and Lombard street is just up the hill, along with Fisherman's Wharf. Walking to Pier 33 for Alcatraz takes 10-15mins, or you can take the tram for $2 person, simply catch on the corner by Walgreens. Biggest downside is that parking costs $34 per day.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and close to the tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: stephandsimon
Reviews.Content: Typical Courtyard Marriott, quiet, comfortable, safe, just an easy place to stay, no troubles at all during our stay, with great beds. We stayed three nights at this hotel after checking into another hotel our travel agent had booked (lets just say it was scary) and out again within the hour. There was a conference in SF that weekend which took up most of the available bedding in the city, finding a place for six adults for three nights was difficult, but the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful where other front desks were indifferent. The breakfast was good, the rooms were spacious and well appointed, the beds were fabulous and the tariff was affordable. We walked out at night to Fishermans Wharf, and explored the city easily from this position, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a home away from home in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Really good option!”
Reviews.Author: Eurotravel
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. We chose the Courtyard because the rates were reasonable ($119) and they allowed up to 4 people in the room. Many other hotels in SF restrict it to 2 people and/or make you pay extra, so that is a benefit. The hotel itself is located in a very convenient location in the Fishermans Wharf area on Beach Street, just a street up from the main street, Jefferson, where all the action is. It's a basic hotel room, but clean and well appointed. The staff could not have been more friendly and nicer. You really can't go wrong. As far as getting there, we realized there isn't an easy way to reach Fishermans Wharf from either airport (Oakland or SFO), unless you don't mind dragging your luggage from BART to streetcar (and streetcars don't always run on schedule as we unfortunately learned on a rainy, cold day). We elected to take a taxi from SFO ($45), which with 4 people really made sense anyway, as it would have cost us nearly the same to buy BART and streetcar fares. The hotel breakfast option was probably the only aspect that wasn't great. Maybe it was just circumstance, but when we went down for breakfast one morning, there was a long line and the staff had difficulty keeping up with the orders. You order at the counter and some of the food was given immediately and some was delivered to the table about 10 minutes later...we enjoyed breakfast at two eateries which are located diagonally across the street on Columbus Street, Pergamino Coffee & Tea (really cute and quaint place with HUGE pancakes) and Happy Days Diner (good standard fare). The Boudin Bakery is also a nice option for lunch or light dinner. It's affordable and during the day you can watch them make bread which they shape into crabs and other sealife. Most restaurants in Fishermans Wharf are terribly overpriced and the menus all seem similar. Try McCormick and Kuletos happy hour that starts at 3pm, it's really reasonable. A wonderful find for dinner was Bocce Cafe in the Italian district at 478 Green Street. It's a brisk 15 minute walk from the hotel up Columbus Street, and well worth it. The food is good and reasonably priced and the atmosphere is great, with live music. Excellent. We will definitely go back. If you get tired of walking and taking public transportation, another nice option is that Avis and Hertz are located in the same block of the hotel. We went online and rented a car for the day and drove to areas we couldn't access easily like the Golden Gate Park, as well as driving across the Golden Gate Bridge and into Marin County. Definitely make your reservation online as they will charge you more in person.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible shower, won't be back”
Reviews.Author: scdaren
Reviews.Content: Other than location, there are two reasons I stay at a hotel - I need somewhere to sleep, and I need somewhere to shower. When either of these two things fail, I don't return. In this case, the water pressure in the shower head was absolutely terrible. Here's a tip - before you shower, fill up the water glasses in the room with warm water from the sink, and use those to help get the shampoo out of your hair. It will save you like 5 minutes. I don't think the problem was the room or the building, the bath faucet and sink had great pressure. I know low-flow showerheads are supposed to save water, but that is negated when you have to spend twice as long in the shower. The showerhead was one of those detachable deals - you could really see the lack of pressure when it was pointed straight up - there was not even enough pressure for water to spray upwards. Otherwise, this is a great property, and certainly up to par with Courtyard's high standards. The location can't be beat if you are visiting SF for the Fishermans Wharf tourist scene. Room was clean, front desk staff polite and helpful, and there was free wifi from AT&T.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location”
Reviews.Author: fancylittlelaminated
Reviews.Content: I brought a group to the Marriott Courtyard Fisherman's Wharf in December of 2007. I was surprised at the fair rate considering the amazing location. It is close to everything. The beds were comfortable and rooms fine for what we needed - nice but not overly fancy. I understand it has been renovated since our stay which is even better.
