The manager welcomed us at our arrival and was helpful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for tourist activities”
Reviews.Author: RCRGator
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points to stay at the Marriott Courtyard Wharf before a trip to Napa. For the price, it was wonderful (we did pay for an extra night too). Great location, walking distance to many tourist atttractions, friendly staff and nice rooms. I really have no complaints. Parking is expensive but that is expected in a city. You can park yourself for $32/day with no in-and-out priviledges or $39/day with in-and-out availability. Overall, a nice hotel with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for stay at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Kitters
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for several reasons: Close to Fisherman's Wharf Marriott Rewards member Parking available at a reasonable price Moderately priced accomodations It fit our criteria perfectly. The hotel is 2 blocks from the waterfront at Fisherman's Wharf, 1 block from the trolley stop, 2 blocks from the Powell and Hyde Street Cable Car. Several tour companies nearby and many choices for dining. Parking next door in the covered garage is $32 per day. The hotel is completing some major remodeling and redecorating, but the rooms have all been re-done with very nice 'trendy' furnishings, including flat screen TV, upgraded bedding, etc. They were still working on part of the lobby, but it was not a problem at all. Work had not yet been completed at the Courtyard Cafe on the 2nd floor, so it was not open. However, the hotel provided a very nice selection of items for a complimentary Continental Breakfast at the 3rd floor elevator landing. Since our room was just down the hall, it was very easy to pick up breakfast and enjoy it in our room. The staff were are very pleasant and helpful and made our 3 day weekend stay in San Francisco very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mdm
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite, it was really nice, spacious and clean. Hotel staff were really polite and helpful. Our room was facing the street and we were woken up by street cleaning(apparently street cleaning happens Tuesday and Thursdays between 2am-6am) and garbage collections so if you are going to book here in the week ask for a room away from the street. The hotel had just finished the lobby area and it looks really nice. On Friday morning we were suprised to see a free breakfast of cereals, doughnuts, juice, fruit and tea/ coffee in the lobby area - a very nice suprise. Sat and Sunday it was free dougnuts, juice, fruit and tea/coffee. I don't know if this is to continue but it was a very nice addition to our pleasurable stay at this hotel. There is still work to be done at the Hotel in regards to their renovations but it is not visible. There was not a safe in the room, which is something we like to have as we are international travellers and like to keep are passports etc safe. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel undergoing renovation”
Reviews.Author: martycommack
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, right around the corner from Fisherman's Wharf. Hotelstaff were helpful. HOtel is undergoing renovations, so there is only one, very slow elevator operating. There is also no restaurant in operation, so only food option is the simple continental breakfast (no charge). If you have Marriott points stay here. If you are asked to pay over $150 a night I would think you can find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Impressive Renovation”
Reviews.Author: WorldHotelCritique
Reviews.Content: The main entrance is almost complete with the new Courtyard lobby. The lounge and business center are in tip top shape. The rooms are magnificent! I love the colors and the excellent use of space. The location couldn't be better. Literally 1/2 block from the F-line.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel located near Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: KarenEman
Reviews.Content: Being remodeled October 2009. Great size rooms. Walk to Fisherman's Wharf (just through the courtyard), boat-launch to Alcatraz, bike/segway tours, Pier 39, restaurants and cable car routes. Lots to see and do. No car needed but you can rent one for the day if you want to visit wineries, Muir Woods or Saulsilito or just to drive across the Golden Gate and down the crookedest street. Free continental breakfast. Booked on the internet and got great rates. The remodeling was nearly done when we visited mid-October 2009. New fitness center and casual restaurant were not finished, but remodeled rooms were spacious, bright and comfortable. Two queen beds and a sleeper sofa - great for families. No pool, though. Highly recommended. Will stay there next time we are in S.F.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LarsDane
Reviews.Content: We should stay for 3 nights in San Francisco before continuing our trip in California. We chose the hotel because it was near Fishermans Wharf, public transport (it is located between two cable car turnstiles and the historic streetcars running on the F-line ). The lobby and some other facilities were being renovated and the restaurant was closed, bus as we travelled with two kids, this was no issue, since we normally tend to either bring some take-away in or find somthing family friendly in the neighborhood. The reception was helpful and managed very well despite the very small space (and I do mean small) which was used as a lobby. Two people and some suitcases - and the room was stuffed! We got a big 2-room suite on 2nd level, facing the street. We were surprised that it was so quiet at night - but maybe that was because the big rush was over. The room was nice, clean and suited us wery well. The bedroom was with 2 queen size beds, one for the kids, one for us, but we could sit in the adjacent room in the evenings without disturbing them. The wireless internet was not quite stable, but when hoooking up with a standard LAN cable everything worked fine (never travel without one!!!). The wharf and public transport just near makes it a breeze to get around without using a car - and a 3-day MUNI pass is highly recommendable - we used the cablecars and the F-line many times every day. The neighborhood seemed safe and we had no problems in going out late as a single person.while the other stayed with the kids. When checking out they were again helpful and a taxi was ordered and arrived just on the spot. Some might have been disappointed with the construction going on - but for us it was no issue - the location is by far the most important. The rates are a bit high - but so are they everywhere in that area. We would defenitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BrisVegas5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a 1 bedroom Suite with 2 Queens and a Sofa bed. The room had been renovated fairly recently and housekeeping was good. We found the location to be nice and quiet, with easy access to public transport. All the staff were friendly and even highlighted maps to help explain where the Cable Cars and F line went. There were renovations happening at the time we were there with the exercise room, reception and restaurant all affected. Continental breakfast was provided on tables set up outside the lifts. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disclose major construction”
Reviews.Author: DAHNashville
Reviews.Content: We scheduled our trip to Open World 2009 and selected this hotel because of it's location to the warf area. We arrived to find the lobby completely closed with construction. There wasn't enough room for 2 of us to check in with our bags. The restaurant was closed for renovation. The workout room was closed. I probably could have lived with the lack of amenities except that they didn't tell us and they charged their full rate. I also discovered this is not a Marriott owned property - it's privately owned and operated. I'd stay away until it's finished remodeling or I'd ask for a reduced rate. You likely will get it as everyone who shows up checks out the next morning. Schedule your own taxi in advance as the taxi line is long for folks leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mselcharro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. Employees were very friendly. Check-in was very fast. Room was very clean and had a couch with fold-out bed. The location of this hotel is great! We will stay again next time we are in the area. A very short walk and you are close to many restaurants, shops, the pier. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunkhedena
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 15 year old daughter were all extremely pleased with the 5 days we spent at the Courtyard in the middle of August. The room was big, quiet and clean. We had two queen size beds and a nice sized bathroom. There is free WiFi in the rooms. The location is excellent. It was enjoyable to get up early and take walks through Fort Mason to Chrissy Field, Coit Tower, Russian Hill, Chinatown and Little Italy. It is an easy walk to the terminus of two of the cable car lines and to pick up the ferry to Alcatraz (we did the night tour). I notice that a lot of people in the forum seem to put down Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. The Courtyard is about a long block from Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, but I considered that a plus and not a negative. The street on which the hotel is located is safe and not as â€œtouristyâ€� as the Wharf, so you can easily avoid it if you see fit. There is an Avis and a Hertz right next to the hotel, so renting a car could not have been easier. As for me, I found the Fishermanâ€™s Wharf to be very crowded and more for shopping than for enjoying the City. However, I enjoyed the view from the piers, seeing the sea lions, visiting the Musee Mecanique, looking for the Bushman and generally walking in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: peterlc63
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accomodations. The rooms were modern, stylish and very clean. The main lobby was undergoing renovation but, we were bothered at all by any noise. The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. Parking is next door for $30 day which is better than some of the other hotels in the area. The location is very convenient but, far enough away from the noise near Pier 39. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mf-sandiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard a few years ago and thought it was fine but nothing special. Well since then, they've remodeled the rooms and now they're both stylish and comfortable. Check out the traveler photos -- the decor is sort of Asian/Zen. We had a room with a King bed and a couch/sofabed. We were surprised at how roomy it was because many SF hotel rooms are small. The rooms are equipped with small refrigerators, flat screen TV, air conditioning, and high (more like slow) speed Internet access. The location is good -- on the somewhat less touristy side of the Wharf. Walk up Columbus to the North Beach area and have some pasta. Walk a few blocks toward the GG Bridge to a small beach and leave the Wharf craziness behind. The Courtyard is located right between two Starbucks (one on Beach in the Argonaut motel bldg; the other by Walgreens on Jones), or there's a good independent coffeehouse called Coffee Adventure on Columbus. All in all, a great hotel in a great location. No view and the Internet access was slow, but everything else was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: avidvacationer75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the last leg of our USA road trip. The hotel itself is in a great location, just off from Fisherman's Wharf, come out of the hotel and take a right and there you are. Check in was painless and quick, staff were very friendly. Room was large and spacious, very clean. Bed was incredibly comfortable, with lovely linen. Bathroom was of a good size and nicely decorated. TV was massive, Proper hairdryer. Would definatly recommend this hotel if you are staying in San Francisco. The only thing I would suggest was that if you are a light sleeper such as myself, take ear plugs the main street outside can be very noisey and the air conditioning is a noisy unit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with a great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: rungirl26
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Courtyard Marriott was wonderful. We were able to check-in early, the staff was very friendly and willing to help us with whatever we needed. The location is great and I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay at Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dingoman
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here, our first in the US after a long trip from Australia. Great hotel, would definitely use again if we return to san Fran. Pros great location. Everything at fishermans wharf an easy walk comfy beds. Wife and I both agree they were the best hotel beds we ever had. Quick check in. We were in room within 2 mins of arrival quiet. Other reviewers have commented on noise but we stayed on Friday night and didn't hear a thing free wifi and plug in Internet checkout is midday cons only one would be room had a slight smell but we only noticed it for a short while each time we returned to room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: gtgraf
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in San Fran and this hotel was perfect for us. Rooms were spotless and trendy. You can walk to anywhere you need to go. I used points to cover the room cost but would gladly pay to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard - good choice”
Reviews.Author: runningman_22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights at the Courtyard with my wife and son (10 yr old). We booked using reward points so aside from the $30 valet the stay was covered. It is in a good location if you are planning time at the Wharf, Ghiradelli Sqaure or hopping on the cable cars. The room was nice, typical Courtyard, with comfy beds and free internet. We did not eat at the breakfast buffet but instead chose the bakery next door and a cafe serving breakfast. Beware that there is no pool...bummer for my son. All in all a good stay, good location if you are choosing Fisherman Wharf for your tourist activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beds, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: fionac1
Reviews.Content: We were not sure where to stay in SF and found it hard to find a good B&B as we left our booking too late but were so glad we ended up at the courtyard Marriott fisherman's wharf. Never having been to SF and because we were only there for a week it placed us in a great position to access everything we wanted to see. cable and trolley cars, the piers, Buena vista cafe with great irish coffee, quirky cafe's for breakfast and any amount of local restaurants for dinner. The Hotel di not present like a typical chain with it's tuscan color scheme and comfortable rooms - coffee and tea always available in the lobby and very friendly helpful staff. We loved it so much we extended for an extra day.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mom_with_Teenagers14
Reviews.Content: Great location, got a great price on a 'name your own' site. Lovely room. Only drawback was a sofa sleeper that was not up to par with the rest of the room and an overpriced restaurant. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet, very comfortable, spotless and very friendly staff. 5-10 min walking to Pier 39 and so close to wonderful restaurants. The price is very reasonable compared to other hotels that are far from Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tectonicgirlWPB
Reviews.Content: This newly remodeled hotel was in the perfect location for my trip with my two young children, we were able to walk to everything we needed, including wharf area shopping, restaurants, attractions and public transit. The concierge was most helpful in giving us guidance for good times and good food. We found the modern asian inspired room (and bathroom) overall welcoming and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: nette010
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel had about 1 hours notice of our arrival, they were able to give us 3 rooms (2 inter-connecting) all next to each other. Considering we arrived on Good Friday we were most grateful that the staff were able to give us these rooms. The newly refurbished rooms were lovely, large and although modern, very homely too. There was a fridge and coffee maker, lcd tv, wireless internet etc. There is a very good breakfast room too where the staff were particularly helpful. The hotel is very well situated for access to Fishermans Wharf, cable cars, boat trips etc. If I had to think of any negative points it would only be that our rooms had a view of the multi-story car park next door, but as we didn't open the net curtains during the day we hardly new it was there.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the San Francisco Courtyard - Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Spillthemoment
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this property. My original reservation was for 2 nights but I found myself needing to check in a night early, unexpectedly. The front desk manager was VERY helpful with this. I called in the afternoon on the date I needed to check in and although the hotel was close to being sold out he not only let me check in one night early, but he honored the low rate which I had for the rest of my reservation. This was awesome service!! The front desk agent at check-in was very courteous. There was one problem, though. I had lost my credit card so I not only had to pay for my room but leave a cash deposit. My deposit was not returned to me upon check-out but I had to wait to get it by mail. This was very dissapointing, as I know it is not the policy followed by the majority of hotels. Now, back to my stay... My room was decorated in a very modern, tasteful manner. Lately, I have noticed that a lot of Courtyard brand hotels are being redecorated in a manner that gives them a very modern feel which makes you feel as if you are staying in something better than your run of the mill budget brand. High Speed Internet (wired) was free which was awesome!! (I had to call the front desk in order to find out that it was free as their is no signage in the room specifying this.) There is a dining area where breakfast is served but I never had any. Parking is about $30.00 in an adjacent lot which isn't bad as I've paid as much as $60.00 per night for parking in other areas of San Francisco. The hotel is located in a pretty good location. The rear of the hotel leads out to the street directly across from Fisherman's Wharf. I've stayed in most San Francisco neighborhoods, at some point or another, and I really think that it doesn't really matter where you stay, as to me, San Francisco is way smaller than it actually looks. The rear of the hotel leads out to a shopping area that includes a Hooters, In and Out Burger,and just around the corner is a Wallgreens (to pick up any toiletry you might have forgotten.) All in all, I thought this was a great hotel and even with the disappointment I experienced with not having received my deposit at check-in, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice modernized rooms”
Reviews.Author: SLCSweets
Reviews.Content: the location is great just steps away from the wharf. we had a rental car and parking is $30 which seems steep, but cheaper than if you were to choose a downtown marriott. the lobby seems a bit dated, but the rooms are the opposite as they have been recently renovated. really modern decor with very nice sheets and LCD flatscreen TV. The room is also really spacious. We went during March which is probably off-peak so it wasn't too loud outside. But it is right behind the In-and-Out and Hooters, so expect there to be lots of people nearby. There was some alarm going off outside during the night that didn't stop for about an hour. Unfortunately, there is no complimentary breakfast like other Courtyard Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, AWEFUL service”
Reviews.Author: tbsunday
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal for the room and it was in a great location. Close to everything. We even took the bart to the hand cars and it dropped us off about a block from the hotel. The rooms were nice and the housekeeping staff was EXCEPTIONAL! Friendly and helpful at all times. The front desk staff, however, was the worst staff i've ever come across. I would walk up to the desk where there would be two employees. One would see me coming and head towards the back and the other one would pick up the phone and start dialing numbers, hang up the phone pick it back up and dial more numbers. I would stand here for about 5 mintues before the person that went to the back would come back and help me but they really didn't seem too happy about it. Also, I got really sick on my trip so I sent my boyfriend to the Walgreens next door for some soup, I called down to the desk to ask if I could get a spoon, they said sure it'll be right there and they never brought it up. Service is so important. That's why it's called the service industry. If they hired nice people to work the desk, this would be an ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “could not have had a better time”
Reviews.Author: lynne64
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renovated and the rooms were nice. We had two queen beds and used the pull out love seat for my child. We also had a small refrigerator. It was convenient to everything we wanted to do in the long weekend. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge were knowledgeable on getting us to where we needed to go. We had a great time, and would stay there again. The free internet was a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2202
Reviews.Content: Got the room for a great price off Priceline! We had an odd shaped corner room. The staff was incredibly nice, offering advice and maps upon check-in. We called down to the lobby for a cab but had to stand there while the nice bellman tried to flag one down. Not one in 15 minutes but appreciated his efforts and walked down the block to a busier corner to catch our own! The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean! There was no bath, just a shower (which is unlike most rooms I guess). The shower was set up strange so that the water sprays right on the door! In other words you can't have the shower door open and have the water on or the whole place will flood! Very great value- the location was priceless. Would recommend this to everyone from couples to families with young children. It's not the wine and dine by a classical piano kind of hotel. Just a good, clean and comfortable place with an awesome location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good experience”
Reviews.Author: keatos
Reviews.Content: I love the Marriott chain and usually stay at the Courtyard Downtown or once in a while the Stanford Court, but waited too long and couldn't get a good rate at these, so I thought I'd try this hotel. I'm not really into Fisherman's Wharf as a location; once you've been there once, that's aoout it in my opinion. However, I liked the location more than I'd thought I would. It's very easy to get away from the wharf area, and walks around the hotel are great. I rented a bike nearby and went over the bridge, so the location was perfect for this. Also, within walking distance is a Trader Joe's, big Barnes and Noble, and a Safeway for convenience. The Courtyard has a very small lobby, and some of the hotel was under refurbishment when I was there (as the website mentioned). My room could have used 'freshening up' but they are working on this of course, and the room was quite satisfying as it was. No major problems. I would stay here again for sure, and as usual, the Marriott beds are great and the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Another Quality Wharf Hotel”
Reviews.Author: creditcrunch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed within the Fishermanâ€™s wharf area of San Francisco with all major attractions and transport options within easy reach. Check-in area was super quick and clean and boasts a small seating area with large LCD screen, free Wi-Fi or you can use the PC with printer again free of charge complimentary tea and coffee and in the evenings an honor bar serving cold beers etc,. I checked in at 9am but no rooms were available so my bags were stowed in a secure area and was told to come back about 12, all very efficient and friendly. After a walk around the wharf I got back about 11 and was called over to check-in and told my room was ready. The rooms here are standard courtyard style, clean and fresh with all the essentials. Bathroom had a tub and shower combo with complimentary lotions and potions, plenty of towels and plenty of space. Bedroom had two king beds, desk with working lamp, executive chair and FREE wired high speed internet!, TV (HBO etc) lounge chair and plenty of hanging space and draws, no in room safe but reception are happy to lock any items. There are full coffee and tea making trays in room and the obligatory ice vending machines on each floor with fully controllable AC and heating in room. Breakfast is served on level 2 in a smallish type room which offers a full chargeable buffet breakfast, which was very nice and sets you up for the day. The exercise room again located on level 2 is small but serves its purpose. There are vending machines in reception and a number of shops in the area. There is parking available and payable locally, the cost is in line with most of the hotels in Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. The concierge service was impeccable and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Having stayed in almost all the hotels in this area I have to say they are all much of the same quality, I would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Traveler555555
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with this hotel. This is not up to what we have known as Marriott standards. I am shocked they put there name on this place. Old decor, sinks that don't drain, tubs that don't drain and over priced parking. Holiday Inn or Best western wiould have been a better choice. Or even the Marriott up the street?

Reviews.Title: “Super location for touring families!”
Reviews.Author: MoCaribfan
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is in a great location for touring the Fisherman's Wharf area (and San Francisco). The hotel is in the center of everything. While the nightly price was steep, you are paying for the location...and what a Courtyard offers (clean, new bedding, nice staff, free internet in the lobby). We had rented a car with Avis for touring wine country, and dropped it off at the Avis garage next door upon arrival (no car needed...you just need to be willing to walk alot). If you go in the summer, make sure to pack accordingly. It was chilly and we all ended up buying fleece jackets ($10 each from a street vendor around the corner)! The Maritime Museum (closed right now but with many ships open for viewing), Ghirardelli Square, Pampanito submarine, Alcatraz boat pier, all of the Piers for touring, the cable car turn-a-round, etc. are within minutes of the hotel. If you go to the ballgame, just catch a bus ($1.50 each) to the ballpark (the front desk will tell you where to go...only a block away to catch it). Ate at Tait's for some clam chowder and fries, Boudin's restaurant for wonderful food in a nice setting, McCormick and Kuleto's (beautiful views), Cioppino's, and Scoma's...all walking distance from the hotel. And, the best part, tourist casual (i.e. jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, etc). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: brownsWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard for 4 days at the beginning of August. The room was very spacious and clean, with a very comfortable bed. The position of the hotel was excellent, only a 10 minute walk to Pier 39. The trolley bus and the cable car were also within a 10 minute walk so getting into Union Square was very easy. The hotel is well placed for the many restaurants that are on Fisherman's Wharf. When we come back to San Francisco we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Should be 3.5”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights over the 4th of July weekend. Overall it was a very nice hotel, but we did have some issues. After our first night, the front desk called us in the morning to tell us there was a water leak in the space below and they needed to come into our room to check it out/make repairs. They were very considerate about the whole situation, and we agreed that we would rather switch rooms immediately than have maintenance in there for an extended time or end up having to switch later anyway. As it worked out, we got a larger corner room with a view of the bay and Alcatraz. They brought a bell cart and moved our (packed) items to the new room for us. The only issue we had with the second room was that the commode was too close to the countertop - there needs to be a "cut-out" section at the end of the counter. All the staff we encountered were friendly. The person at the front desk at check-in seemed to have some problems with checking me in but finally managed. We requested a mini frig and microwave, and although they were older they worked great, and there was no charge. It is a great location for seeing the Wharf area. We were able to see 2 sets of fireworks at the same time from the garage next door. We did have some other minor issues we encountered during our stay. First, the parking garage had increased their prices recently and were significantly higher. (On a positive note, they have an agreement with the hotel so that you can have in and out priveleges and you pay the hotel for all parking charges.) The hotel only has 2 elevators and 1 of them was down for service - for several weeks. We ended up using the stairs a lot (to the 4th floor) as the other elevator was often busy. Upon checkout, the only bell cart that was available was one with underinflated tires so it was extra difficult to push.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay on the wharf”
Reviews.Author: Aroadtripper
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd stay here again. Very good location. Parking building is right beside the front entrance. We stayed two nights and left our car in the garage and walked to everything, including the launch pier for the Alcatraz ferry. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel and lots of extra pillows. Front staff very nice and efficient. The concierge was top notch. Rooms nice. Hotel a bit expensive with the room cost, tax and parking, but this is the norm if you want a room in that area. One suggestion I have is it have a refrigerator in the room at that price. If you decide to eat breakfast on the 2nd floor, be sure to look over the prices for the buffet and contential breakfast carefully that is in the room guide book. I did not check the prices first and the buffet was expensive. Breakfast staff was great and cook great, food fine...just was a lot more expensive that I was expecting. Again, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “family fun in SF”
Reviews.Author: floridatraveldad
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of the Fisherman's Wharf area. My wife and 2 teenagers spent 5 nights here in early June. The staff was excellent, the room was large and very clean, and you just can't go wrong with where it is--1 block from the bay, 2 blocks from Ghirardelli Square, just over 1 block from the cable car turn-around, 3 blocks from Pier 39. Let the conventioneers stay in the Union Square area--this is where the families on vacation should stay. The concierge staff was knowledgeable and friendly. The housekeeping staff was superb. You cannot beat this hotel for the price, quality, and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ...... but .......”
Reviews.Author: Ba11istic
Reviews.Content: The concierge and the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The Courtyard is within walking distance of most attractions. The parking was good. The rooms were above average in size. The only problem was the noise level on friday . On weekdays the noise was minimal bordering on nonexistant. Its the location and its surroundings thats the problem. If you look at the front of the hotel, you will see a funneling affect for the noise level. This hotel and the hotel across the street create a wall that amplifies the noise. Plus the windows are single pane which makes a bad scenario worse. You will notice this when the "Hawgs" start thundering down the street. This " wall effect" reverberates the sound through the room. On weekdays, not many Hawgs roll down the street. However when friday rolls around ........ good luck with the noise. Overall, its an excellent location with an excellent staff. Now if only they can outlaw the " Hawgs" after midnight, then i can get some sleep. Would i stay there again? YES, but only on the weekdays. Unless you're a party animal and sleep is not part of your vocabulary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the Wharf District”
Reviews.Author: AuntieAnne22
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel right in the middle of the Wharf area. Short walk to Ghiradelli Square and other Wharf attractions. We walked to McCormick & Kuleto's (food and views were GREAT). The room was nice with a great view of the street/stores/area. Housekeeping was great with ample towels, etc. The only drawback, Parking in the garage is $32 WOW.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Review of This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B_Pope
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this property, my first being in May of 2007. Since my last stay there have been a few improvements. The bath products are now "Davies Gate" brand, and are quite nice. There were 5 pillows on the bed to choose from. And the courtyard seems a bit more alive, but there are still some empty "for lease" storefronts. Front desk staff seems genuinely friendly and personable, not just "put on." This time I stayed two nights, and I did notice the early morning dumpster noise coming from Beach Street (in front of the hotel), although it didn't bother me too much--I had the heater on, so the fan sound acted as a buffer. Double pane windows would greatly help with the noise issue. The windows are in need of replacement anyway, they are the one thing showing age in the room. Otherwise the room was clean, simple, tasteful, and in very good condition. Maid service did a great job of refreshing the room for my second night. I came by ferry and without a car this time, and it was easy to catch busses to everywhere I needed to go. I recommend walking over to see the fishing boats on the pier near Scoma's restaurant--it's a quiet escape, and a different world in comparison to the noisy din of the tourist area. I hope this hotel continues to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great room”
Reviews.Author: Mimiannb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were very pleased with the larger than average room with a comfortable couch and desk. The breakfast cafe was very nice and the buffet breakfast was generous. The room and lobby were clean and nicely decorated and there was a computer everyone could use in the lobby. The location is excellent as you can walk to the area attractions from Ghirardelli Square to Pier 39 very easily. The cable car stop is only a block away. I would recommend this hotel for everyone except people who want luxury or don't like children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good breakfast cafe”
Reviews.Author: SusanAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel canâ€™t begin to compete with the over-the-top grandeur of The Palace Hotel in the heart of the city, BUT it is a perfectly fine hotel for touring San Francisco. PRO: (1) The location is great! Only one block from where you catch the â€œstreet carsâ€� and two blocks from Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. (2) This hotelâ€™s breakfast cafe is a bit better than the average Courtyard Marriott cafe. Instead of putting out a scrambled-egg buffet to get hard and cold, a guy cooks you a fat, made-to-order omelet. PLUS they have the best little blueberry muffins I have ever tasted and I donâ€™t even like blueberries. They are made fresh every morning. One morning, when I showed up 10 min. after the cafe had closed, the omelet man (who had already put up his ingredients) insisted that he cook an omelet for me. And he did it with a smile! Bravo! CON: (1) The hotel is crammed into a high commercial area and there are no good views, but whoâ€™s going to stay in the room, right? (2) The concierge was WORTHLESS! When I asked about an open-air tour, he discouraged me and emphatically pushed an expensive 3.5 hour tour on an enclosed bus. I told him repeatedly itâ€™s not what I wanted, but he insisted that I did. I thought he must have a good friend who works with the tour company. I did some research on my own and found out he had given me some incorrect information and when I told him about it the next day, he didnâ€™t even apologize. I noticed that some earlier reviews on this site said he â€œwill not stop talking,â€� that heâ€™s â€œannoying,â€� and that he â€œwas so rude.â€� The concierge is supposed to be someone you have confidence in. This guy was - well, I suggest you go online and do your own research before relying on him.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sightsnsounds
Reviews.Content: I ended up booking this hotel because of a great deal I received for working in the travel industry. Based on previous reviews and the pictures I had seen I knew not to get my hopes up too much. I have to say the location COULD NOT be beat!!!! We were just a few blocks away in either direction from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the Cannery, and Ghiradelli Square (and a cable car stop). Just a few blocks up the road was the North Beach area of town though we didn't get to wander around this area as much as we would have liked. The check-in was quick and easy and we were given a room on the 2nd floor- which I believe was close to the breakfast area based on the morning noise and clanking dishes. One thing I was very pleased with was the cleanliness of the room and that housekeeping left us additional towels the next day. We had a very of the parking garage next door which wasn't a big deal since we weren't in the room very often. The bed was comfortable and the internet access was quick. The lobby had coffee available each morning which I really enjoyed for the convenience, though there is a Starbucks around the corner about a block up the road. If you plan on renting a car at any time Avis and Hertz are located next door in the parking garage which was extremely convenient as we took a day trip to Sonoma. The two things I didn't care much for with this hotel was that it was a fairly old hotel that could use some updating and the walls seem to be paper thin. I could hear everything at all times of the day from the neighbors next door to the clanking dishes in the restaurant and also the people and traffic outside. All in all this hotel did what it needed to do- it provided a clean, safe place to stay- and the location could not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: T_Loves_to_Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in January 2008. We chose this hotel for its location and price. Pros: The room was clean and nicely furnished. The location is amazing - right on Fisherman's Wharf, with many conviences right nearby: Walgreen's, Starbucks, the trolleys, many restaurants. The concierge at the hotel is really nice and very helpful arranging a bus tour for us. The breafast great and the hostess was very pleasant. The bathrooms were clean and nice, with a large tub and nice toiletries. Cons: The views from many of the rooms will not be great. Our room's view was a blue parking garage about 10 feet away from the window. But, since we did not spend much time in the room, it was fine with us. Parking costs $22 a day, so if you are not going anywhere but San Fran, I recommend not renting a car since it costs so much to park. Hertz rent-a-car is right next door to the hotel in that blue garage, so if you change your mind you could alwyas get a car right there. Other recommendations: The motorized cable car tour offered by Gray Line Tours was fanstastic - I highly recommend it. Also, I recommend eating at Scoma's - great seafood. Skip the cable car at the west end of the wharf - you will wait in line forever and then be packed in it like a sardine - you can take the trolley that starts right in front of Walgreen's for way cheaper and it takes you to the same end point at the fancy cable car. We traveled with my 5 year old son and he loved the Rainforest Cafe, Ripley's museum, and the sea lions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: vinson7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days between xmas and new years. Was a good location for me since it was my first time in SF. Was close to the wharf, cable car, gharedelli square, etc. Its a coutryard marriott, so you don't expect ritz carlton quality. I was ok with the accomodations, nothing different than other courtyards from my experience. I used pts, so don't know how good the value is, but parking is next door in a garage.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible- stay away”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a privately owned franchise location for Marriott that is not up to standards of what I expect from a Marriott Courtyard. We booked a one bedroom suite for three nights but ended up leaving after two. The hotel thankfully did not charge us for our early departure. The room was dingy and just not a nice place to be. The furniture looks like it's 15+ years old. Everything was worn and very very basic. The location is a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf but beware- the bustling fun location during the day becomes desolate and a little scary at night. We arrived from the east coast late on a Thursday and found all of the restaurants were closing or closed for the evening by 10. We will never stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great family location”
Reviews.Author: finschick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before heading up to see the Redwoods. We were able to walk to Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, the Cannery and to the Hyde Street Cable Car stop. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the restaurant had an excellent buffet breakfast. I'd definitely recommend the location, esp. if you have kids. (We were travelling w/ 8 and 6 year old, plus my 75 year old mother.)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but....”
Reviews.Author: ms2112
Reviews.Content: The location is good, parking can be a real pain like anywhere on the crowded wharf. The room was pretty decent as far as hotels go, clean. A bit pricey, but so is everything in San Fran, especially on the wharf. The concierge guy is an interesting character who will not stop talking and tries to explain everything to you, following you around the lobby as you bring your luggage in. He thinks he is being helpful, but it is a bit annoying, someone there needs to tell him, as he repeats this same long winded speech to anyone coming in the lobby door. I noticed that some others complained about losing their rooms due to overbooking, that happned TWICE to different people that I saw just in the two nights we were there. Marriot needs to do something about that......

Reviews.Title: “Arrive early...or else”
Reviews.Author: docbfree
Reviews.Content: For Fisherman's Wharf this is not bad. For the rest of San Fran, you can do better. Was initially very disappointed when we arrived with our 3 children at midnight only to find that the hotel had been over booked and there was not a room waiting for us. Thus we had to go down the street to the currently being remodeled Sheraton for 1 night. Room there was comped, but smelled of smoke. Anyway, the staff at the Courtyard understood our complaints. I had even called the hotel at 5 PM and told them of my anticipated late arrival. They knew I was coming with kids as I asked if there were any rollaways still available. On the second day of our stay they contacted me and said they did have our room available and there was a rollaway already in the room. They also provided buffet breakfast for the remainder of the 3 days. They stated that upper management overbooks the hotel in order to guarantee they will be full. This still does not make sense to me because if I don't show up, the room is still charged to my credit card. The hotel itself is reasonably clean. Rooms were standard Courtyard rooms. Hallways dark and depressing. Staff very nice and accomodating. For a little more $$, would consider the Argonaut down the street or a hotel in downtown area.
